cshelp.title: Templates
cshelp.shortdesc: The Templates page shows the defined virtual machine templates that can be used to create KVM guests.

csbody.p: For each template, the following information is displayed:

dlentry.dd: Name of the operating system or distribution.
Version of the operating system or distribution.
Number of processors that are defined for the template.
Amount of random access memory to be allocated, in MB.

csbody.p: The following actions can be selected for each template:

ul.li: Select Edit to edit the template.
Select Clone to copy a template.
Select Delete to delete the template.

csbody.p: To add a template, click the plus (+) icon.
For each template, the following information is displayed:

dlentry.dd: Displays the name, vendor distribution, version, memory, file path to ISO file, and graphics preferences.
Specify the storage pool information for the template.
Displays the default network interfaces available to the KVM guest. You can select multiple networks.
In the CPU Number field, specify the number of processors that are defined for the template.
Select to Manually set CPU topology for each guest.

cshelp.title: Add template
cshelp.shortdesc: Add a template from source media. You can add your own ISO image to 'ISO' storage pool for following discovery.

csbody.p: Select the location of the source media from the following options:

dlentry.dd: Select to scan storage pools for installation ISO images available on the system.
Select to specify a path to the local image file.
Select to specify a remote location for an installation ISO image.

cshelp.title: Add template - ISO image
cshelp.shortdesc: Add a template from a ISO image.

csbody.p: The ISO images available on the system are remotely are displayed.

dlentry.dd: Name of the operating system or distribution.
Version of the operating system or distribution.

csbody.p: To create a template from an ISO image, choose from the following options:

ul.li: Select an ISO image from which to create a template, then click Create Templates from Selected ISO.
Select All to create a template from each listed ISO image, then click Create Templates from Selected ISO.

If the ISO image that you want to use does not appear in the scan results, you can select from the following options:
Select I want to use a specific ISO file to specify a path to the ISO image.
Click Search more ISOs to search for more ISO images.
